intro: Sium annuum, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine, though they can be toxic if not prepared properly. The plant plays an important role in supporting local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
